Break the core out in a kind of cone shape or cut it regularly in about 1.5-inch pieces.
Put the words "wow" into the steamer insert.
(You can poke a paring knife into the stem, or until you can feel the texture in the steamer insert still a little, if that, then add the insert, cover and cook for about 20 minutes.).
Dump about half of the cauliflower into the food processor.
Pour in the nuts milk.
Puree the nuts milk until smooth.
Now dump the rest of the cauliflower on top.
Now puree again.
Stop, scrape, and stir in the puree a few times.
Once smooth, add the butter, salt, pepper and garlic.
Once smooth, mix.
Taste to season.
If you do n’t eat immediately, you can reheat low-heat in the same pan.
Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350°.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Using a stand mixer with the paddle attachment, beat the butter, cream cheese, light brown sugar, granulated sugar and vanilla extract until the mixture becomes light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, making sure they are fully incorporated, scraping down the sides as needed.
Add the dry mixture a third at a time until mixed.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Using a cookie scoop, place 1-2 tablespoon mounds onto the parchment paper about 2 inches apart.
Bake the cookies for 12-14 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.
For best results, place dough in refrigerator overnight or for at least 30 minutes before baking.

In a small pan roast separately the coriander, cumin, peppercorns, cardamom, cinnamon and cloves.
As each one starts to smell fragrant.
Turn on to plate cool.
To.
After roast, peel.
And use only the seeds.
Discard pods.
Put all into electric blender.
And blend to a fine powder.
Finely grate nutmeg.
And mix in.
Store in glass jar with airtight lid.

In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine yeast, water, salt, oil and 2 cups flour.
Using the dough hook mix the dough hook on 2 speeds for about 1 minute.
Add the remaining flour to 1/2 cup at a time until the dough hook is clingy and the sides of the bowl are clean.
Continue to wring the dough hook in mass for an additional 2 minutes.
Place the dough (I then return it to the removed stand mixer bowl, I use the dough often ), then turn the dough into a bowl (I use the stand mixer often ), greased with oil.
Cover the dough with towel or plastic wrap.
(This recipe can be divided in four pieces to make a smaller crust tuesday, or two larger crust tuesdays ).
Place the dough in a warm place to rise for an hour.
Make the pizza according to your favorite direction.

Fry slow.
Place chicken in slow cooker.
Top with pepper and carrots.
In a separate bowl combine the broth ingredients: orange juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, mustard, and garlic salt of the southwest.
Pour over chicken.
Cover on low.
Cook on low for 6-7 hours.
Remove chicken and vegetables from slow cooker.
Keep warm.
Boil sauce.
Take out 1 cup of cooking liquid.
Bring to a boil in a saucepan.
Stir together 1 tbsp.
Add orange juice and cornstarch to sauce.
Stir 2-3 minutes until thick.
Pour over chicken.
Slice green vegetables.
Top with green vegetables.
Cook rice.
Serve with rice.

Preheat oil, you and the loaf pan.
In a large mixing bowl, add the flour, oats, salt, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, and baking powder.
Stir to combine.
In another mixing bowl, beat eggs with an electric hand mixer.
In another mixing bowl, then add sugar.
Beat until well combined.
Add the oil, yogurt, pumpkin, and vanilla.
Beat the oil, yogurt, pumpkin, and vanilla well to mix.
Fake the mini chips into the batter.
Pour into loaf pan.
Insert toothpick in the middle.
Bake for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees, scoop out loaf pan.

Place chicken, tomatoes, enchilada sauce, onion, green chiles and garlic in slow cooker.
Pour in water and chicken broth and season with cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper and bay leaf.
Stir in corn and cilantro.
Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high 3-4 hours.
Preheat oven to 400°.
Brush tortillas (both sides) with oil.
Cut tortillas into strips and place on baking sheet.
Bake until crisp, about 10-15 minutes.
To serve, sprinkle tortilla strips on top of soup.

Sift together in a large mixing bowl flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
In a jug measure out milk.
Separate eggs.
Place egg whites in the bowl of stand mixer.
Add yolks and vanilla essence to milk together.
And whisk.
Pour over the flour mixture.
And very gently stir.
Until about combin.
Melt butter.
Stir in the butter.
And continue mixing very gently until combined.
Beat egg whites until stiff.
Preheat iron.
And slowly fold into batter.
Spoon the batter into waffle iron in batches.
And cook according to its directions.
Remove immediately.
And serve with maple syrup and fruits.

Add the flour mixture and mix on low speed just until blended .
Transfer the dough onto a piece of plastic wrap and wrap tightly .
In a medium bowl , whisk together both flours , the baking soda and salt . 
When ready to bake the cookies , preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. 
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours , or up to 5 days .
Bake for another 6 to 8 minutes , or until the cookies are dark golden brown .
Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat .
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days .
Bake the cookies for 10 minutes and then rotate the baking sheet .
Let cool for a minute on the baking sheets , then transfer to a cooling rack .
Transfer to the baking sheet.
On a lightly floured surface , roll out the dough and cut into 3-inch squares .
Let cool completely ( they will crisp up as they cool ) .
In a large bowl , combine the butter , brown sugar and honey .

First four ingredient in a large mixing bowl combine well-combined.
Evenly spreading a 9x13 baking dish.
Combine ingredients for the peanut butter bar chocolate topping medium glass bowl.
Melt and in the microwave for 1 minute at a time.
From remove the microwave and stirred until smooth.
Spread of the peanut butter bar base.
Place in the freezer for 15 minutes.
Removes from the freezer.
Cut into individual bars.
The size depending on number of bars like you serve (20-36 bars).
